column4: I'm having a challenge - I upgraded my hard drive, and cloned the partitions of the old one onto the new one (using Windows), now I can't get boot loader to work, after trying for many hours...
I'm able to get to windows via supergrub (1.2.1)
have you tried a livecd and chroot into it?
sort of.. I did that as part of one of the web pages on how to fix..http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d69f6c7c0
(more details on what i've done there.)
maybe you didn't clone the hdd fully?
looks right when I look at everything via live cd... but good question.
and make sure bios is set on new hdd
I did set up grub, but I don't really understand the mount stuff... so it may not have stuck
new hard drive is replacing the old one, and boots correctly when i use supergrub
if youd go to livecd we can try together to see what the issue is. if it boot fine why doesn't your linux boots?
I do see that Gparted doesn't understand the partion, but Disk Utils sees everythnig
I have it running on live CD now.. (I'm typing from a borrowed lapop
what fsys did you installed on the disk?
each partition is a bit different, see http://ubuntu.pastebin.com/d69f6c7c0 for the filesystem lists (ntfs and ext3 are set up.)
